titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 67) setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal years, 1996, 1997, 1998, 1999, 2000, 2001, and 2002.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-165, by Mr. Solomon.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 65.

action.text: Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H. Con. Res. 67 with 1 hour of general debate. The resolution waives all points of order against the conference report and against its consideration. Upon adoption of the resolution, the provisions contained in Section 2 of said resolution, pertaining to compliance with the reconciliation directions of the Congressional Budget office, shall be considered as having been adopted.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 233 - 181 (Roll no. 451).
Mr. Hall (OH) moved to reconsider the vote on moving the previous question.
Mr. Castle moved to table the motion to reconsider the vote.
On motion to table the motion to reconsider Agreed to by recorded vote: 236 - 183 (Roll no. 452).
Motion to reconsider the vote tabled.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 234 - 180 (Roll no. 453).

action.text: Mr. Hall (OH) moved to reconsider the vote.
Mr. Whitfield moved to table the motion to reconsider

bill.summary: 6/29/1995--Introduced. Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H. Con. Res. 67 (congressional budget).
